generif.text: processing of caspase 14 in epidermal differentiation

caspase-14, similarly to other keratinocyte differentiation-associated proteins, is downregulated by retinoids, suggesting that this caspase plays a part in terminal keratinocyte differentiation and skin barrier formation
Loss of caspase-14 expression is associated with psoriatic lesions
psoriatic keratinocytes may activate mechanisms that prevent the nuclear entry of caspase 14
caspase-14 is aberrantly expressed in epithelial tumors
there are tumor-specific alterations in caspase-14 expression which may define subsets of epithelial cancers with distinct clinical behaviors
Caspase-14 is present in the human placenta, primarily in the trophoblast, but its function is not clear

caspase-14 has a substrate specificity similar to the group I caspases, and demonstrate that it functions in a distinct manner from executioner caspases to carry out specific proteolytic events during keratinocyte differentiation.
caspase-14 is up-regulated during trophoblast differentiation, as represented by the BeWo cell line
Expression of exogenous caspase-14 led to growth inhibition and reduced the tumorigenicity of A431 skin cancer cells.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
caspase-14 gene is rarely mutated in colorectal carcinomas, but not mutated in gastric, lung, breast and hepatocellular carcinomas
These data reveal the basic organization of the human caspase-14 promoter and suggest an important role of AP-1 and NFkappaB in the transcriptional control of caspase-14.
Expression of caspase 6 and caspase 14 genes were different between normal skin of keloid-prone individuals and normal skin of keloid-resistant patients.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)

Results imply that caspase-14 inhibits trophoblast differentiation.

Purification and characterization of active caspase-14 from human epidermis and development of the cleavage site-directed antibody

Caspase 14 is a cysteine protease and is inhibited by full-length LEKTI and 5 recombinant fragments of LEKTI to varied extents.

Regulation of caspase 14 levels provides a possible link between impaired skin barrier function and inflammatory reactions in skin diseases such as atopic dermatitis and may offer an explanation to the skin barrier dysfunction in inflamed skin lesions.
Casp-14 overexpression correlated with tumor stage, cell differentiation and lymphovascular involvement, suggesting that casp-14 was associated with tumor cell growth and metastatic potential.
A strong association was evident between GATA-3 and caspase-14 expression in preinvasive ductal carcinoma in situ samples, where GATA-3 also displayed prognostic significance
genetic polynorphism is associated with the risk of childhood leukemia
regulation of procaspase-14 maturation during terminal differentiation is a unique two-step process involving KLK7 and an activation intermediate of caspase-14.
Caspase-14 might play a significant role in the pathogenesis of diabetic retinopathy by accelerating retinal endothelial and epithelial cells death.
ceramides, an important structural lipid, stimulate caspase-14 expression, coordinating formation of lipid lamellar membranes with the formation of corneocytes
Suggest caspase-14 is a marker of human skin differentiation during development.
genetic polymorphisms in AICDA and CASP14 are associated with risk for brain tumor in Korean children.
Results suggest that caspase-14 may interact with GCM1 to participate in syncytiotrophoblast differentiation during placental development.
partial loss of caspase 14 is not associated with dedifferentiation in neoplastic lesions of the oral mucosa

Mesotrypsin generated saposins A-D from prosaposin, and mature caspase-14 contributed to this process by activating mesotrypsinogen to mesotrypsin. Knockdown of these proteases markedly down-regulated saposin A synthesis in skin equivalent models.
caspase-14 contributes to retinal pigment epithelium cell barrier disruption under hyperglycemic conditions.

Caspase-14 was decreased in inflammatory lesions compared to non-lesion in atopic dermatitis. The amount of caspase-14 in the lesions correlated with clinical severity as determined by eczema area and severity index score and the skin barrier functions.

overexpression of S100A7 in A431 skin squamous carcinoma cells significantly promoted cell proliferation in vitro and tumor growth in vivo, whereas it suppressed the expression of GATA-3 and caspase-14
High CASP14 expression is a marker of breast cancer aggressiveness in association with proliferation, TNBC phenotype, and cancer stemness.

interpro.desc: Peptidase C14, caspase non-catalytic subunit p10

name: caspase 14

reactome.name: Differentiation of keratinocytes in interfollicular epidermis in mammalian skin

summary: This gene encodes a member of the cysteine-aspartic acid protease (caspase) family. Sequential activation of caspases plays a central role in the execution-phase of cell apoptosis. Caspases exist as inactive proenzymes which undergo proteolytic processing at conserved aspartic residues to produce two subunits, large and small, that dimerize to form the active enzyme. This caspase has been shown to be processed and activated by caspase 8 and caspase 10 in vitro, and by anti-Fas agonist antibody or TNF-related apoptosis inducing ligand in vivo. The expression and processing of this caspase may be involved in keratinocyte terminal differentiation, which is important for the formation of the skin barrier. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
